definitions: surgical procedure that tightens facial skin to reduce signs of aging
process of renovating or modernizing something to improve its appearance
examples: She decided to get a facelift after turning sixty
The surgeon specializes in minimally invasive facelift procedures
The old building received a complete facelift last year
The company website needs a facelift to stay competitive

definitions: flat surface cut on a precious stone or crystal
particular aspect or feature of something complex
examples: Each facet of the diamond reflected light brilliantly
The jeweler carefully polished every facet of the emerald
We need to consider every facet of this problem
This research explores multiple facets of human behavior

definitions: cosmetic treatment applied to the face for cleansing and rejuvenation
anatomical or characteristic features relating to the face
examples: She treats herself to a monthly facial at the spa
The aesthetician recommended a hydrating facial for dry skin
The doctor examined his facial injuries from the accident
Facial expressions reveal our emotions without words

definitions: act of making something easier or helping bring about an outcome
professional practice of guiding groups through meetings or workshops
examples: The new software allows facilitation of complex data transfers
Government facilitation of trade agreements benefits local businesses
She specializes in workshop facilitation for corporate teams
Effective facilitation requires strong listening and communication skills

definitions: person who helps make something possible or easier to achieve
professional who guides groups through meetings, discussions, or learning processes
examples: She acted as a facilitator between the two departments
Technology serves as a facilitator for remote collaboration
The workshop facilitator kept everyone focused on the agenda
We hired an experienced facilitator for our strategic planning session

definitions: building, equipment, or space designed for a particular purpose or activity
natural ability to do something easily and well
service or feature that makes something possible or easier
examples: The new sports facility opened downtown last month
The hospital facility includes an emergency room and surgical wing
She has a remarkable facility with foreign languages
His facility for mathematics impressed his professors
The hotel offers laundry facilities for all guests
Banking facilities are available throughout the campus

definitions: material used to cover the surface of a wall or garment
direction or position that something fronts toward
examples: The building has a limestone facing on its exterior
She chose silk facing for the jacket lapels
The house has a southern facing that gets plenty of sunlight
Check the facing of your tent before setting up camp

definitions: exact copy or reproduction of a document, artwork, or manuscript
transmitted copy of a document sent electronically via telephone lines
examples: The museum displays a facsimile of the ancient manuscript
This facsimile edition reproduces the original illustrations perfectly
Please send a facsimile of the contract to our office
The facsimile machine was essential before email became common

definitions: piece of information that is known or proven to be true
information used as evidence in legal proceedings
examples: The fact remains that we need more funding
Scientists base their conclusions on observable facts
The lawyer presented facts to support her client's case
The jury must consider only facts presented during trial

definitions: small organized group within a larger political party or movement
group within an organization that opposes the main body
examples: The liberal faction pushed for more progressive policies
Different factions within the party competed for control
Warring factions divided the rebel movement
The board meeting revealed deep factions among members

definitions: element or cause that contributes to a particular result or situation
number that divides into another number exactly
company that buys accounts receivable from businesses
examples: Weather was a major factor in the accident
Several factors influenced her decision to relocate
Find all factors of 24 in this equation
The prime factors of 12 are 2 and 3
The factor advanced payment against our outstanding invoices
Small businesses often work with factors for cash flow

definitions: process of finding numbers that multiply together to produce another number
business practice of purchasing accounts receivable at a discount
examples: Students learned factoring quadratic equations in algebra class
Factoring polynomials requires understanding of mathematical patterns
The company uses factoring to improve its cash flow
Invoice factoring helped the startup manage working capital

definitions: building or buildings where goods are manufactured using machines
design pattern in programming that creates objects without specifying exact classes
examples: The automobile factory employs thousands of workers
Safety regulations at the factory have improved significantly
The factory pattern simplifies object creation in our codebase
Use a factory method when you need flexible instantiation

definitions: body of teachers and professors at a college or university
inherent mental or physical power or ability
division within a university devoted to a major area of study
examples: The faculty voted to approve the new curriculum
She joined the faculty after completing her doctorate
He retained all his mental faculties despite his age
The faculty of speech distinguishes humans from other animals
The Faculty of Medicine offers several specialized programs
She's enrolled in the Faculty of Arts and Sciences

definitions: intense but short-lived fashion or interest that gains widespread popularity
examples: The latest diet fad promises quick weight loss results
Fashion fads from the eighties are making a comeback
Social media creates new fads almost every month
Pet rocks were a bizarre fad in the 1970s

definitions: gradual disappearance or weakening of something over time
loss of color intensity or brightness due to exposure
examples: The fade of daylight signaled the approaching storm
There was a slow fade in her enthusiasm for the project
The fabric showed significant fade after years in sunlight
Use this product to prevent color fade in photographs

definitions: process of gradually becoming weaker, dimmer, or less distinct
examples: The fading of her memory concerned her family
We could hear the fading sound of the train
The fading photograph showed her grandparents' wedding day
Prevent fading by keeping artwork away from direct sunlight

definitions: enchanted land or realm inhabited by fairies in folklore and fantasy
supernatural being or fairy in medieval and fantasy literature
examples: The children's book described a journey into the faerie realm
Celtic mythology speaks of passages to the faerie world
The faerie queen ruled over all magical creatures
Ancient folklore warned against angering the faerie folk

definitions: British slang term for a cigarette
boring or tiring task that requires effort
examples: He stepped outside for a quick fag during break
The shop sells fags behind the counter
Cleaning the entire warehouse was a real fag
What a fag having to redo all this paperwork

definitions: weakness or deficiency in character, behavior, or ability
gradual loss of strength, health, or effectiveness
examples: His main failing was his inability to delegate tasks
Despite her failings, she was an excellent leader
The doctor noted the patient's failing eyesight
Her failing health required constant medical attention

definitions: lack of success in achieving a goal or desired outcome
sudden cessation of normal functioning in a system or component
person who has not achieved success in life or career
examples: The project's failure cost the company millions
Learning from failure is essential for growth
The engine failure forced an emergency landing
Heart failure requires immediate medical intervention
He felt like a failure after losing his job
Society shouldn't label people as failures

definitions: brief loss of consciousness caused by insufficient blood flow to brain
barely perceptible sound, light, or other sensory impression
examples: She had a faint in the crowded subway station
The nurse attended to him after his faint
We detected a faint from the distant radio beacon
There was only a faint of light through the curtains

definitions: large public event with entertainment, exhibitions, and commercial activities
organized event where employers meet potential employees
examples: The county fair features livestock competitions and carnival rides
Local artisans display their crafts at the annual fair
The career fair attracted hundreds of college students
Tech companies dominated this year's job fair

definitions: outdoor area where fairs, circuses, or exhibitions are held
examples: The fairground covers twenty acres outside the city
Vendors set up their booths throughout the fairground
Children ran excitedly through the fairground toward the rides
The fairground hosts events throughout the summer months

definitions: mowed area of a golf course between tee and green
navigable channel in a body of water marked for safe passage
examples: His drive landed perfectly in the middle of the fairway
The fairway narrows significantly near the water hazard
Ships must stay within the marked fairway when entering port
The harbor fairway is dredged regularly for large vessels

definitions: small imaginary being with magical powers typically depicted with wings
offensive slang term for a homosexual man
examples: The tooth fairy left money under her pillow
Children's stories often feature fairies and magical creatures
Using fairy as an insult is offensive and outdated
The term fairy in this context reflects harmful stereotypes

definitions: imaginary land inhabited by fairies or a place of magical beauty
examples: The garden looked like a fairyland with twinkling lights
Children imagined adventures in a distant fairyland
The snow-covered forest seemed like a winter fairyland
Her bedroom was decorated to resemble a fairyland

definitions: story for children featuring magical events and imaginary creatures
situation or story that seems too good or unlikely to be true
examples: She read a fairytale to her daughter every night
Classic fairytales often contain important moral lessons
Their romance was like a fairytale come true
Don't believe his fairytale about making millions overnight

definitions: strong belief in religious doctrines based on spiritual conviction
complete trust or confidence in someone or something
examples: Her faith helped her through difficult times
People of many faiths attended the interfaith dialogue
I have complete faith in your abilities
The team showed faith in their new coach

definitions: group of loyal supporters or believers, especially religious adherents
examples: The faithful gathered for Sunday morning worship
The preacher addressed the faithful with an inspiring sermon
The team's faithful cheered despite the losing season
The faithful never abandoned their political leader

definitions: object made to appear valuable or authentic but is actually worthless copy
person who pretends to be something they are not
examples: The painting turned out to be a clever fake
Customs officers seized thousands of fake designer handbags
Don't trust him; he's a complete fake
The supposed expert was exposed as a fake

definitions: fast-flying bird of prey with long pointed wings and a hooked beak
examples: The peregrine falcon is the fastest bird in the world
A falcon circled high above the desert landscape
The trained falcon returned to its handler's glove
Falcons have exceptional eyesight for hunting prey

definitions: person who trains and hunts with falcons or other birds of prey
examples: The falconer demonstrated the ancient art of hawking
Medieval nobles employed falconers to train hunting birds
She became a licensed falconer after years of training
The falconer wore a thick leather glove for protection

definitions: art and practice of training falcons to hunt game in cooperation with humans
examples: Falconry has been practiced for over four thousand years
The sheikh's passion for falconry is well known
Learning falconry requires patience and dedication
Falconry equipment includes gloves, hoods, and perches

definitions: instance of dropping or descending from a higher position
season between summer and winter when leaves change color
loss of power, status, or moral standing
examples: His fall from the ladder resulted in serious injuries
The fall broke his arm in two places
New England is beautiful during the fall season
We plan to visit in fall when leaves change
The scandal led to the minister's fall from grace
The fall of the empire took centuries

definitions: error in reasoning that renders an argument invalid or unsound
mistaken belief based on unsound reasoning or false information
examples: The argument contains a logical fallacy called ad hominem
Students learned to identify fallacies in debates
It's a fallacy that lightning never strikes twice
The common fallacy that money brings happiness persists

definitions: alternative plan or course of action for use in emergencies
examples: Keep some cash as a fallback if cards aren't accepted
Teaching was her fallback career if acting didn't work
The system includes a fallback to manual operation
We need a fallback position for negotiations

definitions: radioactive particles falling from the atmosphere after nuclear explosion
adverse results or side effects of an action or event
examples: The nuclear test created dangerous fallout over the region
Fallout shelters were built during the Cold War
The political fallout from the scandal lasted months
We're still dealing with fallout from that decision

definitions: statement or assertion that is untrue or deliberately deceptive
examples: The witness was charged with uttering falsehoods under oath
His story was a complete falsehood from beginning to end
Spreading falsehoods on social media has serious consequences
The report exposed numerous falsehoods in the official statement

definitions: artificially high voice used especially by male singers above normal range
examples: The singer's falsetto reached impossibly high notes
He switched to falsetto for the song's chorus
Pop singers often use falsetto for emotional effect
His natural falsetto rivaled trained sopranos

definitions: action of falsifying information or altering something to deceive
examples: The accountant was arrested for falsification of records
Document falsification carries severe legal penalties
The falsification of research data ruined his career
They discovered falsification in the financial statements

definitions: state or quality of being untrue, incorrect, or based on mistaken ideas
examples: The falsity of his claims became apparent during investigation
She exposed the falsity of the conspiracy theory
The report highlighted the falsity of common stereotypes
Logic can reveal the falsity of flawed arguments

definitions: state of being known or recognized by many people for achievements
examples: Her fame spread quickly after winning the Olympic gold
The artist achieved international fame with his sculptures
He struggled with the pressures that come with fame
Instant fame through social media rarely lasts long

definitions: person well known to someone through regular contact
spirit or demon believed to attend and serve a witch
examples: He greeted familiars at the neighborhood gathering
She was surrounded by familiars from her childhood
The witch's familiar took the form of a black cat
Medieval texts describe familiars as supernatural servants

definitions: close acquaintance with or knowledge of something through experience
examples: Her familiarity with the software saved valuable time
Years of travel gave him familiarity with many cultures
The familiarity between old friends was immediately apparent
Too much familiarity can breed contempt in relationships

definitions: group of people related by blood, marriage, or adoption
taxonomic group of related organisms ranking below order
group of related things or objects with common characteristics
examples: The entire family gathered for the holiday celebration
She comes from a large family with five siblings
Lions belong to the cat family of mammals
The rose family includes apples and strawberries
This family of products uses the same technology
Romance languages form a family of related tongues

definitions: extreme scarcity of food affecting a region and causing starvation and death
examples: The drought led to widespread famine across the region
International aid helped prevent famine after the war
Historical famines have shaped migration patterns worldwide
The potato famine forced millions to leave Ireland

definitions: device with rotating blades that creates airflow for cooling
person who has strong interest in or admiration for someone or something
examples: The ceiling fan helped circulate air throughout the room
She used a handheld fan during the outdoor concert
Football fans packed the stadium for the championship
She's been a fan of the band since childhood

definitions: person with extreme and unreasonable enthusiasm or zeal for something
examples: He's a fitness fanatic who exercises twice daily
Religious fanatics disrupted the peaceful demonstration
She's a fanatic about keeping her car spotlessly clean
Political fanatics on both sides prevented compromise

definitions: excessive and single-minded zeal or enthusiasm especially for religious or political causes
examples: Religious fanaticism has fueled conflicts throughout history
His fanaticism for the team borders on obsession
Political fanaticism prevents rational debate and compromise
The cult leader's fanaticism attracted vulnerable followers
